summary: When an inept group of criminals tries to get a stolen top-secret computer chip through airport security, it ends up in a toy car in the luggage of the elderly Mrs. Hess (Marian Seldes). Unable to promptly retrieve the chip, the felons follow Hess and the car to her neighborhood. After she gives the toy to young Alex Pruitt (Alex D. Linz), who is home sick from school, he becomes the target of the criminals. However, the precocious kid is on to their schemes and ready to fight the thieves off.

reviews.content: Terrible movie. Dull and boring, not much even happened. Even the pranking part ( Which is usually the best part in a home alone film) was dull and boring. I give it a 15%.

The crooks had a much-needed upgrade! Still stupidly fun to watch. Wow, Scarlet so young, this her first?

5.6/10

It was ok. It doesn't deserve the Hate it gets. The acting was alright with very generic characters that make it hard to get invested in anything with bland dialogue and over the top generic villains. The cinematography in this is good and the best part of the movie. The music is ok, sometimes it stands out more than others. It is worth noting comedic sound effects make you roll your eyes more than laugh though. The editing is not that good and the biggest flaw as it feels like this wants to be a Cat & Mouse Spy Thriller half the time and a comedic family comedy at the same time and doesn't know how to make it work well. The pacing is ok with noting really happening for most of the film leading to the final big gags & traps which only last about 15 minutes. The traps are a bit over the top and farfetched but entertaining none the less. Overall nothing is truly broken in this but nothing really stands out either. I will say the jokes fall flat most of the time and this shouldn't have been called Home Alone 3. It is a very misleading title which I'm sure was done on purpose. Honestly its not really worth seeing besides nostalgia purposes.
Its an okay film, but not as funny as 1 and 2

Despite cool traps and good performances, Home Alone 3 does not prove itself worthy in comparison to its classic predecessor mostly because of poorly and forgettable characters, a lack of christmas feel of to it and a truly cliched story.
LOL, the funniest 01 hour: and 42 minutes ever.
I mean its okay, not as good as the others but it wasnt bad. It passed the time.
A silly premise, especially for a Home Alone movie. It lacks in comedy at times, but the booby traps are even more over the top than ever.

Not Kevin, but great.

The kid is relatable and the toy car really carries the plot. Great film once you accept it's a new kid.
My 2nd favorite home alone film
The movie only works if you are four years old. Doesn't feel like a Christmas Movie at all.
To be honest, I only watched it because Scarlett Johansson was in it. Don't make the same mistake as me.

3 and a half out of 5. Home Alone 3 is the beginning of the series downfall, but that does not mean this movie is not funny. Structurally it is a step down from the first 2 and same with comedy but at same time the comedy still holds up and the film is a non stop laugh fest. I recommend this if you need a good laugh for sure, though, 2 in the end is the best one and the best bet for a great time.

An awful reboot that throws out all the charm and originality of the original two films, and instead gives us a lowsy and lazily written film that lacks everything great about both the previous installments. There really is no redeeming factor of this movie, and even the villains are just too goofy for this film. Overall, there isn't much else to say except that this film was just not very good or memorable, which (considering it is a "Home Alone" movie) just makes this all the more worse.

[⭐️64%]

Expectations were low going into Home Alone 3 (1997) as it didn't bring back Macaulay Culkin and it was initially a concept which didn't lend itself to a franchise, however this direct-to-video sequel managed exceed expectations. It is by no means on par with the original but Home Alone 3 (1997) doesn't completely rehash the formula like Home Alone 2: Lost in New York (1992) had done. It was going in a solid direction until the story unfolded and got goofy. Yes this franchise is intended for a young audience but there were still moments for adults to enjoy, however here it is filled with slapstick which will entertain kids, but probably not adults.

At the end of the day Home Alone 3 (1997) is a sequel which never needed to happen, just like all of the Home Alone sequels however it is harmless and isn't ridiculously bad like imagined.

The charm of Home Alone 1&2 was that there was a boy who was scared yet resourceful, taking on two petty thieves who were bumbling idiots. It was only slightly far fetched. Home Alone 3 was simply unbelievable. International spies who had evaded the authorities for decades get outsmarted by a kid and a parrot that were both too competent to be credible. The antics were funny though.

Home Alone 3 is really nothing special. It lacks much needed good action and replaces it with nothing more than child comedy which doesn’t get by well with most people. I would recommend watching the first one again if you haven’t seen it already.
It follows in the footsteps of the first movie and manages to be good entertainment, without getting lost too much. (4.5/10)

Don't know why this sequel gets crapped on the most, but as far as stand alone sequels go, this one is rather good! So it doesn't have the original characters in it; it doesn't need them! Really, this is truly a hidden gem that deserves better than what it got. Just pretend part 4 and beyond don't exist, and call it a trilogy! Or look at it more as it's own movie. Either way, I recommend it.
I hate all of the people who knocked this movie's rating down. 🖕🏼

The characters you know and love? Nope. This film us just a painful copy of home alone. Not only is it's plot of terrorism completely stupid, but the characters are dumb, boring, or just flat out annoying.

John Hughes stooped to new levels of lazy when he did this final movie in a five-picture contract with 20th Century Fox. He just put the Home Alone sticker on it and let it fly.
You can put lipstick on a pig and it's still bacon in the end.

I underwent an escalating series of surprises watching this as I went into it blind and was not aware in advance that Macaulay was not in it, then was surprised that the boy they replaced him with was pretty good, then was even more surprised that the movie didn't suck & the booby traps still felt fresh and creative after they seemed to have been drained of ideas by the end of the second movie. The villains made up in quantity what they lacked in quality, the plot device for leaving him home made more sense and the old lady was as good in her role as either of the old people in the first two movies had been. This movie was also notable in that I tickled my own funny bone when my wife commented how unlike the first two movies this one was in that the kid hadn't been forgotten; I replied that they shouldn't have called this one Home Alone & should've instead called it At the House By Himself.
my favoritt of the movies.

It was originally going to have Macaulay Culkin return as Kevin and he would face a new pair of burglars. Honestly, the movie would've been a whole lot better if that was the case. I'm not saying Alex is a bad character, I'm just saying he doesn't that charm that Kevin had. Just saying. I do like Scarlett Johanson in this movie I think she's one of the things that almost saved this movie. But overall, I'd say this one is just a recycled version of what it was going to be, what it was trying to be, and most of all, the first 2 films.
Ask Child & Adult/Now:  8/10.  80/100
This movie is a disgrace to the first two fun and classic Home Alone films. They took the fun Christmas movie concept, and ruined it with bad acting, bad story, and terrible gags. Just skip this one.
The complexity of the story will bore the younger audience as it drags on and an older audience will find this instalment too corny.
Crap, could barely even get through 20 minutes after 3 times
The traps, the comedy, the action pretty much everything in this film is just "MEH". My Grade: C

This movie is just meh. It's not good. It's not bad. It's just meh. I don't think it deserves all the hate it gets, but I wouldn't consider it to be underrated. And that's not because of the change of cast, but because of the humour, and how it's NOT funny. It's not that I grew sick and tired of the slapstick genre, but because it's more exaggerated than JUST slapstick. One of the booby trap scenes shows one of the antagonists getting electrocuted over a long period of time, leaving little to no room for other needed parts of the movie. But when it comes to characters, they're good, but not as great as the ones from the first two films that made the series work. You see, in the first two films, all of the family were a$$holes, but in this movie, the family is surprisingly decent. Even the two siblings are supportive after a few pokes. And if you're a fan of the first two movies, you would probably agree with me, that the family in those movies were so cruel, but that made it more interesting when they were actually nice. But with this movie, the family is kind of bland and boring, and that's not me considering the fact that a cruel family is a good one. But anyway, let's talk about the star of the show here, Alex Pruitt. Alex Pruitt is the main protagonist and replacement of Kevin in this film, and he never really seems to pay off what Kevin had done so well, which was giving an in-depth look into the character. You see, instead of being a whiney baby, and a genius in disguise, Alex is kind of just smart as if it's normal to be that smart.
It kept the kids entertained. And little did we know the Black Widow was in this😜

Recycled plot, uninteresting characters
'Home Alone 3' is the first of the Home Alone movies not to feature Culkin in the main role and the same villains. However, the plot is very similar to the original 'Home Alone' film. Instead of two comical villains, we get three or four of them. This film involves some traps, but it also has a long scene with a remote-control car. The slapstick humour is consistent as well, but the young boy and the villains really fail to make an impact in this film. (No pun intended.) This film offers nothing new or different than the previous films did, and there really is not the warm, holiday feeling or subplots that the other two films had. It's more of a pure comedy, but it did not succeed in making me laugh as the characters really did not do it for me. I would not recommend this film; it's pretty boring. If you are seeking a good holiday family film with comedy, then watch the original 'Home Alone' movie.
I thought the movie was good.    Alex Linz and the villains all played their characters well.   It is difficult to follow Home Alone 1/2.
I thought it was great!   Better than Home Alone 2 by far.

Not the home alone. I think you are looking for a bur. You are better off with 1 or 2. This movie is by the same director with different cast members. There is no manual Culkin in this film. Good overall movie and felt like a movie from—the director but a very different feel that wasn't Christmas or home alone. The mom leaves the kid home with the chicken pools for an hour while the kid tries to stop the burglaries by calling the coos and using his telescope.
Had a very small amount of semi funny moments. Wouldn't watch again. Not a patch on the first two films.
It a good movie for a child. I was hesitant to watch it with my 10 year old due to the bad reviews, but he enjoyed it so much. A wholesome movie. The child actor is great as well.

Poor sequel to Home Alone. It doesn't even take place around Christmas, instead taking place in January. Already a big mistake, especially for a movie released on Christmas. The script is trash, the acting lousy, the plot is absolutely ridiculous and it's extremely tonally confused. Nothing that worked from the first 2 movies is present here. If more effort was put into this movie, it could've at least have been decent. As is, this trainwreck that John Hughes probably wrote in his sleep started the path of this series tanking.
Corny.  The actors don't come close to recapturing the vibe of the original.  Just enough dumb humor to keep me watching.

This movie shouldn't exist. The movie is a cash grab but, it's a failed attempt because there is no Kevin, Marv, and Harry. This movie has cheap laughs and the traps are like the first two movie with Maculay Culkin.
It is not enough to say that this movie was bad. This movie made me wish I had not been born, would I have been saved the pain of having seen it.
Just why ? Why was this made ? Cahs grab mutch ?

Good watch, probably won't watch again, but can recommend.

This kid definitely isn't Macaulay Culkin, but Alex D. Linz was able to carry this movie, and he did it again in "Max Keeble's Big Move".

I'll be honest I re-watched this because "Hot Ones" mentioned Scarlett Johansson was in it, and I couldn't remember that.  She has a bit role, but even back then (possibly unrefined, the role didn't have a lot to work with) she was a big personality in a small role.  She has one, brief, powerful scene that would really be worth remembering: most of it is the messing up the burglars.

This has a very different vibe than the first 2 movies.  While Kevin was isolated and unable to get help, Alex starts by doing everything right to get help, but no one believes him so he feels forced to "do the right thing".  However it manifests in almost a psychotic fashion.

Of course, almost everything that happens in this movie should kill someone, but doesn't.  It also had a very easy out: at any time Alex could give the chip up, and it would be over, the bad guys leave the country: he's heavily volunteering for this carnage.  Kevin was being targeted, he saw their faces and was actually defending himself and his home because the "wet bandits" were coming for HIM.

Ultimately it's fun and charming, and interesting what the limits of technology were back in 1997 with cellphones and pagers, RC cars with block long range, but not wireless cameras, but remote control gizmos that can turn on the neighbors tv.

The biggest problem I have with it is that his brother's bird is basically as smart a person, having conversations, and taking bribes (or insisting on being paid at least), and the worst bit is that I know there are people with birds as smart as that.  I'm not sure if it would be a Conure, but I don't deal in parrots.

That said, it's not overly hilarious, it's not bad, but it's just not great either.
An incoherent story to go along with the lack of laughs.

Kevin is out and not a recast. I give them credit for trying something new. The plot is silly, The bad guys are silly, and our lead actor is not the best. This is a good movie  for kids who are stuck at home with nothing to do and not much to watch. You will at least get a chuckle at seeing Scarlett Johansson as kid, giving us some bad acting.

I loved the first Home Alone, thought the sequel was okay, but this messed everything. Terrible writing and a new kid. Watching this movie, I could not deal with them bringing in a new kid. This movie shouldn't exist and I can't believe anyone had the nerve to make it.

Home Alone 3 is the third film in the Home Alone series, but the first film not to be directed by Chris Columbus. The film was directed by Raja Gosnell, and stars Alex D. Linz as Alex Pruitt and Aleksander Krupa as Petr Beaupre.

The story I found to be all over the place and very convoluted, especially for a film about children being alone, but I guess they tried something new unlike Home Alone 2.

The acting was weak and wooden, especially the four criminals, but at least Alex D. Linz as Alex was better then Macaulay Culkin as Kevin in the second film.

The characters I found to be uninteresting and quite frankly bland, especially Alex and the four criminals.

The film did also have some very poorly done practical effects, especially one involving two criminals falling through wooden tiles.

The music may not be on the level of John Williams score from the first two films, but at least it wasn't too distracting or ear piercingly bad.

The comedy was hands down one of the worst aspects of the film, especially with the slapstick.

The film wasn't boring at any point, but it was very uninteresting and over all pointless.

Over all I give it a
2/10
Even worse than the first two, terrible graphics and abusive behavior.

Home Alone 3 tries to recapture the spirit of the first two films whilst still daring to be different but, despite the intermittently funny script from John Hughes, Home Alone 3 is more of an in-name-only entry that feels more like a mockbuster with higher production values than usual rather than an official entry in a series that likely should've stopped after the second film.
3.5/5.  The main plot is actually more interesting than either of the first two films, but the 3rd act booby traps aren't as good.

The new lead is sadly not able to hold his own, the plot is more ridiculous than the first two films which kept it simple, the villains contain no funny personalities, and the Christmas theme of the movie feels lost. A waste of a family comedy, that I'm truly sorry I liked as a kid.

Of course Home Alone 3 is not as good as Home Alone and Home Alone 2 Lost In New York but this film still provides laughs such as the lawnmower falling on one of the burglars. Alex D. Linz does a good performance and calls the cops when he needs to which is a good lesson for kids to learn.
This is the 2nd best of all 5 home alone movies. I do not like home alone franchise that much
It's okay, but the acting is quite bad and some characters feel completely unnecessary.

Home alone 3 is a lot different from the original home alone. Basically they brought in a different kid because Macaulay Culkin wasnâ(TM)t in it and he was getting older. I liked that they brought in another kid to play the younger child as Kevin but the storyline itself I was not a big fan of.

What a Disappointment this is to the 1st and 2nd films, the Cast is so Shit as hell, The Plot is retarded, and it's like Foodfight! but with no Food for fighting with, it will definitely be the worst sequel to Home Alone.

this film was absolutely diabolical. I wish I could get all the copies of this disk nuclear bomb them and flush the ashes down the toilet that's how bad it was. The kid had a really annoying voice and the robbers were terrible actors

Home Alone 3 is a refreshing installment to the Home Alone franchise that is just as fun and creative as the original.
Great Sequel Better Than Part 2 But Not Better Than Part 1 But Still Good.

series so strongly lacks plot and is terribly missing Macaulay Culkin and is a freaking rerun of the first two, just nobody realizes it becuase of the stupid extra villans, the only thing keeping me from giving this 0 stars is the good old slapstick humor (which sucks compared to the 1st and 2nd)
the hate for this one make no sense. So many laughs from this one. Love it.

The plot is similar to the original, no additions at all, and others. We actually got lots of villains here at least four of them. This movie doesn't offer anything, other than it's just another thing you want to say. You really enjoy it as a kid. Yeah, that's just another cheap reason to say about this movie. Just watch the original. But, if you want to watch it with your family, this is really recommended for you.
Not my favorite different characters so I was not a fan of it

1/10 This movie is an insult to a holiday classic.

3.25/10. There's just nothing good to say here. There's an occasional contorted face that might make you chuckle. You get to see a young Scarlett Johansson. It's hard finding anything good to say about this tired, lazy, annoying movie. It's poorly written, amateurishly acted, and nearly devoid of laughs. It's clear John Hughes and the studio were just looking for a quick cash-in.

Clearly tries to live off of its predecessor's success, but the confusing plot and unlikable characters make it worse. The only reason to watch the film is for the traps, despite them being entirely unrealistic and extremely precise. Not recommended
Why was this movie even made? Sure, it's fun to watch when you're bored, but it's nowhere near as good as the original.

Pssst.... It's not a bad movie... In fact, it was quite clever. Mr Hughes, the GOAT, was also rather fond of the 3rd installment. 

Home Alone 4? Thats a different story that made Hughes and any other passed on Home Alone actor/crew roll in their graves...
Really bad could not capture the magic of the first or the goofiness of the second, it just fails.
Although the movie is definitely a cash grab, it is still an OK movie.

The story is a complete rehash of both of its predecessors as expected, the acting is pretty bad, and the humor is just childish and stale for the very most part. Not the worst sequel of all-time, but I'd still skip it.

Let's be honest here, this is not a very good film. It has nothing to do with anything that made both previous films so iconic and memorable. The casting and performances are mediocre at best, the setting and music score lacks any feeling, and the humour is humourless. A sequel that just needs to be forgotten. I can't even see this film as an actual sequel to the two previous classics.

I thought this was a refreshing sequel with a character even younger than Kevin was but also even ore clever and dangerous. Kevin's lack of sadness in this instalment I also enjoyed as it allowed for his curiosity and adventurousness to come out whilst he was 'Home Alone' rather than just Kevin's intense desire to kick back and relax (however entertaining that was). Finally I found the new criminals more enjoyable with their lack of stupidity also entertaining against the increased cleverness of Alex. Furthermore, having 4 criminals rather than 2 allowed for greater banter and even inside jokes made some of their scenes even more comedic. On the whole I thought this film a strong sequel with an equally strong storyline and cast.

most amazing home alone I have seen funny and all around outstanding story line . the first one was great but this is definitely my favorite one

Just a good film. The previous 2 are better, in my opinion as they better combine and show the fun and silliness alongside the love and heartfeltness (not a word but still). This one is a little more serious and I can understand why some just wouldn't get the silliness of the previous films. To me though, as I said, this isn't as good, however it is definitely still a good film and worth watching (if you like the style that is).
It would have been a better film if it was still Kevin McCalister and his hilarious booby traps.
I think the movie is very good, and I enjoyed i just as much as the first two.

This was just ok. There were some good moments that made me laugh but there weren't enough of them. Alex D. Linz isn't a bad kid though, he's just not as good as Macaulay Culkin. The booby traps aren't too bad but some of them are just plain lethal and fatal. Spoiler alert: one of the weapons is an electric chair. The traps were funny but just over the top crazy. One of the biggest problems was the plot. A group of terrorists must get a chip to take control of a missile, and the chip is in the boy's RC Car so they must break into his house to get it. This plot really makes Home Alone 3 really not feel like a Home Alone movie. The first two movies were plain and simple, while this one has a complete plot that ruins the movie a little bit. Overall this is just an ok movie without a full reason to watch it. C
Oh my god !!!!! What is this piece of shit !!!!!
This is the Home Alone I grew up with and my favorite in the series

This is an awful film. The first 2 Home Alone's were entertaining and they were also good. Home Alone 3 fails to impress without a doubt. I think people thought it was a good idea to make a third Home Alone film, and I thought so too until I realised that Raja Gosnell was directing it. He is an awful director and his worse films have got to be The Smurfs, along with this film. A lot of people disliked this film as it doesn't star Macaulay Culkin. Instead it stars Alex D Linz as the main character. And he is an awful actor, Macaulay Culkin's acting is a lot better. Home Alone 3 is just poorly directed, badly made and the jokes are just poor. I didn't find any of the jokes funny. If you are looking for a bad comedy then this is the one for you. If you want to see a great comedy then there is nothing for you here. God awful film with a poor plot, poorly written script and poor acting. What a complete joke
I've seen worse, but it's kind of a disappointment that the late-great John Hughes still wrote the script for....this

"BOY VERSUS BURGLARS PART 3" 

- 'Home Alone 3' is a 1997 comedy film written and directed by Raja Gosnell (Scooby Doo, the Smurfs) and is the third film of the 'Home Alone' franchise. No Macaulay Culkin, but a new boy, Alex D. Linz (Race to Space) is introduced as the new protagonist. Although many of the events and even the family have been inspired by the previous films, I did enjoy the film. Perfect around Christmastime. With Olek Krupa (Eraser, Salt), Rya Kihlstedt (Deep Impact), Lenny von Dohlen (Twin Peaks, Teeth), David Thornton (the Notebook), Haviland Morris (Gremlins 2) and Scarlett Johansson (the Avengers, Lost in Tokyo). How would you defend your house against burglars? 

After placing a stolen microchip into a remote control race car to get it past airport security, the bag it is in gets mixed-up with the bag of an old lady called Mrs. Hess. Now terrorists Peter (Krupa), Alice (Kihlstedt), Burton (von Dohlen) and Earl (Thornton) must seek the old woman to retrieve the car. Unknowingly for them, Mrs. Hess has given the toy to her neighbor Alex (Linz), who has to stay at home because of the chickenpox, while his mother (Morris) is gone to work and his brother Stanley and sister Molly (Johansson) are at school. When the crooks show up, Alex feels it's his duty to protect his home...

Same Formula, New Cast, More Villains. Writer John Hughes Comes Up With What Should Have Been The Final Home Alone Film. Alex D. Linz Stars As Alex Pruitt, Who Is At Home, Due To Illness. His Mum & Dad Work All Day & With His Siblings At School, He Is Home Alone.

This Time The Plot Focuses On International Smugglers, As They Have Stole An U.S. Navy Missile Chip & Plan To Sell It To The Highest Bidder. A Mix Up With The Bags In The Airport However Has Them Losing The Stolen Goods. So They Decide To Track It Down & Get It Back, While On Their Hunt Through The Houses Of Alex's Neighbourhood, He Sets Up Booby Traps To Catch The Criminals Red-Handed, When They Decide That His House Is Next.

Different Plot, Same Formula. What You Get Is Hilarious Results (Sometimes Funnier Than It's Predecessors), But Now  It Starts To Get Too Unbelievable &  With The Very Little Acting Talent On Show The Film Quickly Begins To Become Boring As It Starts Out Promising. But It Manages To Stabilize Itself Around The Average Mark & Sits Nicely Their. The Final Home Alone Film In My Eyes, This Was Followed By 2 TV-Movie Sequels, "Taking Back The House" (2002) & "The Holiday Heist" (2012).
It still manages to bring in some good old fashioned laughs.

A lot of people didn't really like this movie that much. I respectfully agree, this movie is not a good movie, but it is not that bad. This film goes to a new direction by adding a new family, a new kid, and a brand new group of villains. Unlike the first two films, where Kevin is being chased by a couple of burglars while accidentally being put a situation that would cause him to be alone. In this film, Alex, who is the new central protagonist, is being chased by a gang of smugglers that want to get their hands on a military-class data chip could possibly cause war or something like. As the kid finds out more about the reasoning of the chip and smugglers we have our traditional slapstick humor.
This film is not a great one, but it is not THAT bad. Like, there are some humorous moments here and there. The slapstick is pretty funny at some points, others are JUST do brutal. Like I am watching a horror movie. The kid is the serial killer and the smugglers are that group of idiotic teenagers that walk themselves in the obvious traps laying around. Seriously, they don't notice the NOTICEABLE traps in this movie. Also, the point where the parents leave the kid alone turns into a pointless comedy routine. In the original two, losing Kevin was tragic moment in the parents lives. In this film, the parents leave him alone ALL THE TIME!  That is poor parenting. 
Bottom line, Home Alone 3 is an average family comedy that really does manage to get a few laughs out of you, but there are a lot of inconsistency's. Also the premise is more of a James Bond/Mission Impossible film rather than a Home Alone. If you want to see this, check it out, but I think that would be a terrible idea, but DON'T SEE THE FORTH ONE! Go see the original two.

This movie has truly been miss-treated.  Sure, it's definitely not as good as the first two, but it certainly doesn't deserve the beating it's currently taking.  It was supposed to be a separate story from the McAllister's.  The whole drama between the Mother (Alice) and Alex and family altogether has cooled down, and wasn't as harsh in the first two, plus the fact that this sick 8-year old kid took on 4 PROFESSIONAL agents with often times unexpected traps was such a laugh.  People often complain about Alice constantly leaving Alex alone making these supposed "false alarms", without realizing that both parents have WORK.  Good stuff aside, what I didn't like was that the villains took their pain in a bit too silly a way.  Childish sound effects, pratfalls, and... a snow blower falling on top of Jernigan's head with its blades rolling, was WAY too violent.  The biggest flaw I've seen in the movie, is that if these villains were so professional, why wouldn't they put a tracking device within the toy car in case they lose it?  BUT... then we wouldn't have a movie would we?  I say watch it, along with the first two.  IT'S NOT THAT BAD!  I rate this movie 7.6/10
As far as kids films go this isn't terrible.

it was okay when I was 4

As I was disappointed with Home Alone 1 and 2, I remembered as a kid that I always found Home Alone 3 to be the absolute coolest, so I figured it was worth taking a shot, and that I really had nothing to lose, even though it doesn't feature Macaulay Culkin.

That was too much to expect.
Of course, the script is a pathetic attempt to make Home Alone 3 seem like a story that comes from the perspective of a child haunted by an entire world against him, when in actual fact it proves to be a cheap and repetitive rehash of its predecessors with the change being that it revolves around a remote control car and that Alex D. Linz helms the lead role. He does it well enough, but the script he's stuck with is poor and he is no Macaulay Culkin. He does manage to keep things mostly alive though, so he's certainly successful.
But the story dissolves from what it once was into some childish fantasy about taking on criminals with a remote control car, and although that entertained me as a kid and may still entertain child viewers, for the rest of the population it's a challenge to please.
The worst parts of the script are the lines given to Seth Smith and Scarlet Johansson, who serving as the older brother and sister to Alex Pruitt respectively have to intimidate him, but do it with cheap and pathetic lines and poor direction from Raja Gosnell. Perhaps Seth Smith is part to blame, but there is no way Scarlet Johansson can be because today she is one of the most talented female actresses around, but why she had to start of with sub-par material of this quality isn't good for her.
Essentially, the dynamics are uncreative and repetitive, failing to please fans outside of juveniles, and there is no real creativity or originality to it save from the efforts of Alex D. Linz to make Home Alone 3 a movie worth seeing or remembering. The second Home Alone jumped the shark, while this one jumps it again, but it could have been worse. Good thing it wasn't.
lost its charm. no maculey... no point.

The problem with turning out sequels to Home Alone is that that the original concept is not something that you can build on.  Here you have a premise of a kid left home alone who has to use physical stunts and painful booby traps to defend the house from adults who want to do him harm.  That's not exactly an epic idea.  It wasn't a thoroughly ingenious concept for the first one and the sequels only make it worse.

Home Alone 3 reeks of desperation.  Every element that made the other two films endearing to kids is gone and has been replaced by insufficient copies.  Gone are the entire original cast, Macaulay Culkin is now a teenager and wisely turned down an offer to make this movie.  Gone are Joe Peschi and Daniel Stern who obviously have better things to do.  What remains is a name-only sequel - a remake really - that offers no hints of what turned Home Alone into the best-selling comedy of all time.

Culkin has been replaced by a new kid, Alex D. Linz, a cute little mop-top who probably has screen presence but, for me, is nothing more than your standard Hollywood acting kid.  Linz plays Alex Pruitt, a different kid who lives in the same kind of suburban Chicago neighborhood with a smaller family (mom, dad, a brother and a sister, who is played by Scarlett Johannson), and an even smaller house.  As the movie opens, he gets the chicken pox, which never seems to spread beyond a few small red dots on his neck.  He's one of those kids fused with ingenuity and a room loaded with every toy imaginable, including his own telescope and a large pet mouse named Doris.

The outside forces that invade Alex's space come from four all-star professional criminals who are tracking a computer chip that they have stolen from a North Korean terrorist group.  In an effort to get it past airport security, they hide it inside a remote controlled car and put it inside a shopping bag.  At the metal detector, the bag is mistakenly picked up by an elderly woman who takes it home.  The crooks track her to her neighborhood but can't locate the toy car.  That means they will have to search them all one by one.

Alex spots the crooks through his telescope and, unlike Culkin's character, at least has the sense to call the cops right away.  The crooks make a break for it before the cops can show up, and that leads to two irritating scenes in which Alex is able to identify the perpetrators AND their car, but the adults are too stupid to do anything but warn him about making phony phone calls . . . twice!

As the crooks zero in on Alex, he decides that he has to take care of things himself and that leads to a long, very long, third act in which he sets up a large series of booby traps that include bricks to the head, shots to groin, electrocution, break-away floors, and even a runaway lawnmower.  Those scenes are sheer torture, they  go on and on and on and on until you just want to wave a white flag.  Much to my pain and suffering, as I sat through Home Alone 3, I could imagine that no movie this bad could possibly spawn a Home Alone 4.  We'll see.
Another good example of a series that shouldn't have gone to three movies

In the third installment of the Home Alone film series, a boy named Alex Pruitt receives a remote-controlled toy car as a gift from his father. However, the car happens to have a secret chip that holds the information about the missile guidance-system of the United States. With such an awful premise, who can expect anything more than this charmless, poorly made and acted disgrace?.

All in all, not a good movie, and definitely not better than the first two.

Home Alone 3' is the first of the Home Alone movies not to feature Culkin in the main role and the same villains. However, the plot is very similar to the original 'Home Alone' film. Instead of two comical villains, we get three or four of them. This film involves some traps, but it also has a long scene with a remote-control car. The slapstick humour is consistent as well, but the young boy and the villains really fail to make an impact in this film. (No pun intended.) This film offers nothing new or different than the previous films did, and there really is not the warm, holiday feeling or subplots that the other two films had. It's more of a pure comedy, but it did not succeed in making me laugh as the characters really did not do it for me. I would not recommend this film; it's pretty boring. If you are seeking a good holiday family film with comedy, then watch the original 'Home Alone' movie.

This movie's story is about a little boy named Alex, not Kevin, Alex because Kevin not in this movie because none of the original characters are in this movie that's because this movie has nothing to do with Home Alone despite the fact that it carries that name so why does it carry the name Home Alone? Because it's a fucking horrible movie! Anyway it turns out that Alex's parent's leave him home every day since they have to go to work. Meanwhile, the road where Alex lives is haunted with spies who want a chip that has been planted into a toy car that has been mixed up with another toy car so they go searching into every single house along the street and escape whenever Alex phones for the police. When Alex's house becomes the next victim, he sets up traps that involves being really precise and not being a centimetre away from anything. This movie was bad and I mean bad! It completely abandons everything from the first two Home Alone movies and fucks them up. Just looking at the front cover makes me cringe. Is there anything worse than this? No wait- Home Alone 4!!!!! Home Alone 3 gets a Some Old Bullshit/10!
